description: Decimal expansion of square root of 26.
comments: Continued fraction expansion is 5 followed by {10} repeated. - _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 03 2009In the Gaussian moat problem, a moat of width sqrt(26) exists. - _Paul Muljadi_, Jan 28 2011
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Ellen Gethner, Stan Wagon and Brian Wick, A stroll through the Gaussian primes, American Mathematical Monthly 105 (1998), 327-337.
prog: (PARI) { default(realprecision, 20080); x=sqrt(26); for (n=1, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b010481.txt", n, " ", d)); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 03 2009
crossrefs: Cf. A040020 Continued fraction. - _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 03 2009
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
